alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany; Tangipahoa; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 24 at 4:03PM CST until January 24 at 5:30PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southern Tangipahoa Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Washington Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Northwestern Pearl River County in southern Mississippi... Southeastern Walthall County in southern Mississippi... * Until 530 PM CST. * At 403 PM CST, the public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain with water approaching businesses in downtown Covington. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hammond, Bogalusa, Covington, Franklinton, Abita Springs, Tylertown, Varnado, Madisonville, Folsom, Sun, Enon, Bush, Crossroads, Dexter, Robert, Natalbany and Angie. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 55 in Louisiana near mile marker 31. Interstate 12 between mile markers 40 and 67. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
